thread.title: Gigantic penguins waddled the Earth at the same time as the dinosaurs
thread.title_full: Gigantic penguins waddled the Earth at the same time as the dinosaurs

author: Yahoo News UK
title: Gigantic penguins waddled the Earth at the same time as the dinosaurs
text:
View photos
Picture REx More
It’s not the easiest thing to picture, but gigantic penguins may have been around during the age of the dinosaurs – after a fossil hinted that penguins are much older than we thought.
Fossilised leg and toe bones found on New Zealand’s South Island came from an ancient and very large penguin – thought to be almost five feet tall.
It dates back 61 million years, and is among the oldest penguin fossils ever discovered.
MORE: The classic mobile phones we miss the most (GALLERY)
MORE: Universities to offer ‘fast-track’ two-year degrees
Comparing the remains to previously discovered penguin fossils, researchers believe that the fossil proves that penguins were more diverse than previously imagined by 60 million years ago – hinting that they probably evolved during the age of the dinosaurs.
View photos
‘Penguins had reached enormous proportions early on in their evolutionary history and were already more diverse 60 million years ago than we had previously assumed,’ said lead author Dr. Gerald Mayr of Germany’s Senckenberg Research Institute.
‘This diversity indicates that penguins probably evolved during the age of the dinosaurs more than 65 million years ago.’
go.’
